node.title: Civil War
node.description: Just under 200 years ago, Abraham Lincoln foresaw a great crisis coming upon this union - a crisis of division. As a republican candidate, he made a speech centered around the comment of Jesus, "A house divided against itself cannot stand." We are living in a time where it seems that our church is divided against itself. Will it go through? Surely it will, but not divided. Yet we find that corporate division tends to stem from internal division within our hearts.
